subject: The Big Tuna
event:
ESPN reports that Bill Parcells has signed with the Miami Dolphins to take over as their new director of football operations.

That sound you hear is me grinding my teeth.  Why the hell couldn't the Tuna have signed with the Falcons, as he appeared to be on the cusp of doing just two days ago?

I loved Parcells as the Giants coach.  I loved him as the Jets coach.  I hated it when he walked away from both teams.  And I got really pissed when he went over to the enemy and rebuilt the Cowboys.  And now he's going to do the same thing for the Fins.

Things just got that much harder for my poor Jets.  Belichick and Parcells both in the same division.  Sigh.

comments.article:
I think you are giving Parcells too much credit.

First of all, he won't be happy as director of football operations. He'll want to coach again.

Secondly, as a born and bred New Yorker who took an 8 year detour to live in the Sunshine State, I think that he will leave as Jimmy Johnson did, unsuccessfully. And to put it in basketball terms, Larry Brown couldn't rescue the NY Knicks.

The Fins are cursed for the way they pushed Shula out. I don't believe anyone will be successful there for a long time.
Word is Ron Wolf is reccomending Scot McCloughan from my 49ers.  I really hope we don't lose him.  His players have been pretty good so far.
Hiring Parcells is the first step, but it won't amount to anything until Miami fires their GM (Mueller?).
Parcells will be his boss, won't he?

George,

FYI: Your Giants have bigger problems than just Eli Manning. Everyone complained about Eli after that dreadful Redskins game, but I don't think I've ever seen so many dropped passes in a single game.

I know you are not high on the guy, but until some guys around him start making plays this team will struggle offensively. I am not saying Eli is great, but I think he receives more than his fair share of the blame when the Giants struggle. It's strange: New Yorkers have nothing but sweet things to say about Chad Pennington *gaffaw*, but this will be the third straight year the G-Men have made the playoffs under Manning.

Anyone, I hope the Giants go into week 17 needing a win to make the playoffs. Somebody needs to rattle the Patriots' cage.

Go Packers!!
comments.subject: Giants

comments.article: Parcells is only in it for Parcells, George.  He's a villain no matter where he ends up.

Well, it's a very, very small beacon of hope that there's light at the end of the tunnel. The organization is broken from top to bottom though, IMO, and I'm not sure how much Parcells can do from the director of football operations position.

At least they got a win. Maybe magic will strike twice and they'll win their match against the Patriots... (I am certifiable, just for thinking that, I am sure.)

The Dolphins have needed ... something... for a long time. I'm not sure if Parcells is it. But, it's a start. As someone else noted, the loss of Shula was a tremendous hit; I also hold on tightly to my Marino jersey. :-p I'll just be glad when this season is over, my poor 'fins.
What he should have done if he wanted to make an impact was offer to coach the Chiefs, who are far more broken than the Falcons are.
As you can imagine, I'm overjoyed. I don't love the Tuna but we sure need something positive and we need it desperately!

Well, Marv Levy has improved the Bills so let's see if old Parcells can fix the Fish. With the exception of the Jets his performance history says he will. He may not take them to the promised land, but he'll put their feet on the right path.

I can't believe he used the Falcons to get that job.  Not like their year hasn't been bad enough, now Parcells publicly plays the Falcons and Dolphins against each other.  At least Arthur Blank pulled the deal before Parcells could turn him down.  Now what?

I didn't want to bring it up, but since you did, it was a real stinker of a move by Parcells.

Then this evening I see his interview and he says that Huizenga is the reason he joined the Dolphins. This is the guy under whose ownership the Fins have continually gotten worse. Ironic considering his main claim to wealth... trash.

Just wondering.

And why would your fans want updates about your football tastes? :P
comments.subject: Progress on Dance?

comments.article: That's pretty low the way Parcells stuck it to the Falcons, but it's also pretty funny.  Stay tuned folks, this guy inherited a 1-15 Patriots team, a 1-15 Jets team, and took them both to the playoffs, so he could be the one to start the turn around for the fish. Too bad he sounds like Winnie the Pooh when he speaks.
comments.subject: Tuna

comments.article: I am curious to see what Parcells can do for the Dolphins. I am a cowboys fan. It is cool to see George loves nfl football because right now my two highest interests (hobby) are A song of ice and fire and nfl football.
comments.subject: I like Big Tunas  move

comments.article:
Am I the only one who thought of Dolphin safe Tuna when they heard about this?

Just wondering
Funny, very funny. I didn't think of it. Thanks for the chuckle.
It is sort of interesting that between front office and coaches, three of the teams in the AFC east are now products of the same system.

Oh, George. I pity you. The worst thing in the whole of the world is a Giants/Jets fan. Things that bother me...........

1. We were spurned by Parcells...... Twice
2. The would be coach of the Jets (belichick) resigned the day after it looked like he would be OUR head coach. He then went on to become the greatest coach of all time. For a division rival no less.
3. As if things were not bad enough on the Parcells front, his Son-In-Law is the brillant creator of said belichick's Patriots.
4. The Giants new GM Jerry Reese was a terrible hire. He's a loud mouth idiot with an eye on the comminssioner's office. (The NFL would be insane to even consider it).
5. The Giants fold like a cheap suit the second half of EVERY Year. (Except the year fossel put his balls on the cinder block, which by the way, was awesome).
6. Rich Kotie (I need say no more)
7. The Giants have more bad apples then the witch from sleeping beauty.
8. The Jets are like a drawer full of butter knifes and Leon Washington
9. The Giants drafted a good quarterback, all the fans (and the GM) need to leave him alone. (and George.... the hefty lefty would be terrible)
10. Trick Plays
comments.subject: George Young is rolling in his grave....

comments.article:
GRRM said, "Belichick and Parcells both in the same division."

Sounds like an exciting division to me

As a laboring Dolphins fan, this is one of the few pieces of good news to come from this dreadful season.  While my fellow Dolphins fans and I were pondering just how long the Tuna will stay with the team, we all think it can be nothing but a good thing for our sad little team down in south Florida.  Let the rebuilding begin, proper!
comments.subject: Go, Fish!!

comments.article:
Your writing is slower than Wayne Chrebet. Your writing is to slow, what a jets fan is to general stinkiness.

Go Tuna! Fix the Fish!

My wife questions whether I would have ever started reading your series, if I had known you were a jets fan. The answer is... Probably not. I hate you. But I love your books.
comments.subject: The Tuna

comments.article:
Just amazing to me that you would've let a person's team affiliation have any bearing on whether or not you'd read a book written by them.

I will be happy when the Fins get better though. My brother is an avid Miami fan and as I've watched my team improve (The Jags, if you wanna know. Start the flaming now.) as the season's gone on, I've watched the dolphins struggle and come close, without getting that win. Well, until Baltimore threw their game.

Before you hate me too, bear in mind I don't hate other teams in my division (Though the Colts have been a source of aggravation for me this year.) just because they're in my division. I just hate the Cowboys. :)
comments.subject: Re: The Tuna

comments.article: GRRM, I wonder if you've read "The GM" by Tom Callahan? If not, you'd do well to check it out. It's basically a retrospective on Accorsi's entire career combined with Accorsi's analysis of the Giant's in '06. Any Giant's fan would be remiss in ignoring it.

Right, the Dolphins are an aging team who need to be completely rebuilt from almost point zero. If John Beck pans out then might have something to start out with on offense with Beck/Ginn/Brown .. maybe. But they need to rebuild their offensive line, defensive line, and secondary. This actually is fairly interesting in terms of a deal, whether it works out remains tobe seen.

AS for the Jets I wouldn't be worrying about them yet. Remember Parcels took time to build the Cowboys to what they are. Also, he hasn't won a SB without Belli yet, has he?

As a Floridian, I'm glad to see that the Fins might have a chance...kinda knew something was gonna change considering our amazing record this season.

On an unrelated note, I was looking through my links the other day and found the Valarian Steel website, which hasn't been updated in quite a while. Wondering if anyone knew anything about how the swords were coming.....
Hope you and Parris are having a good holiday.  Oh, and hoping to see that there new book in 2008...
comments.subject: Merry Christmas!

comments.article: Merry Christmas, everybody!
